column4: I installed ubuntu alternative, I can log in, but then it plays the song and nothing else happens
I installed 6.10, and I logged in and nothing happens
it looks like something tried to pop up, but it's really fragmented and weird
If so, you might get back to the login with control-alt-backspace
Does it freeze up at the song?
OK, here's a test: go into your bios, and disable the sound card.  Then try.
If it works, it's something with the sound card.
ok, can you switch to <alt><f1>, at the text login?
login as yourself, and see where it's at at the login.  Be interesting to see where it's hanging up at with a ps -ef
how did you install it? With the live CD?
Might be something with your video card.  What kind is it?
Well, don't know what I can suggest.  In the past, when I've had this sort of locking up, I fixed it by updating my bios.  So you might want to check if there's a bios update for your mobo.
